text:
A spiraling descent into darkness greets you. The air grows heavy, wet, and full of whispers that slither past your ears. Stone gives way to something older — not carved, but grown. You step onto a floor of black crystal, and your reflection in it moves a half-second late.

This is the Abyss. Not death, but memory made real. Every step further is a shedding of self. Voices call to you — not to stop, but to *remember*. What you were. What *you did*.
lore: The Abyss is not a place, but a scar left behind by the first sundering of flame. Those who enter risk becoming echoes — shadows of will without name. Yet sometimes, the echoes speak truths the living cannot.
